website_summaries.verdict: An improved formula from a well-known baby laundry detergent brand.
pros: With a hypoallergenic formula specifically created to tackle stains, this is an all-around great option for all your baby's laundry needs
Parents who use cloth diapers love that Dreft is safe for use on all types of cloth diapers and inserts
cons: Pricey per ounce, but users agree that it seems to be worth it

customer_reviews.title: DON'T EXPECT BABY POWDER SCENT
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised a "hypoallergenic" product for children has such a strong, perfume smell. Pretty gross. Disappointed. I can't comment on its efficiency as a cleaning product because I can't get past the perfume stink. I will try to give this away, and hope someone will take it.
customer_reviews.author: Portlander

customer_reviews.title: Best Detergent for Baby
customer_reviews.text: First of all, can we just talk about the "baby" smell for a minute? This is it! It has to be one of my favorite scents on the planet. On top of that, it's hypoallergenic. My son has eczema something serious and this doesn't flare him up at all. I love that they sell it in a two pack so I don't have to worry about it for a while. I've used Dreft for all three of my children so you should take my word for it! Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha M.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good product, disappointing packaging!
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and noticed that the containers had leaked. I love this product to get those tough stains out of my girls clothes. I hate that the stage 2 doesn't come in a bigger container. Other than that it's good. Just disappointing that I spend so much money on it for it to be open when it gets to me.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Strawbridge

customer_reviews.title: better than the rest, which makes it the best
customer_reviews.text: Dreft is tops for many reasons, but after trying other detergents for babies - especially babies with sensitive skin (eczema in this case) - there is none better than Dreft. It cleans the clothes - including the 'accidents' (poop, i'm talking about poop) - and leaves clothes looking fresh. If you want the best detergent for your baby/kid, get Dreft and stick with it.
customer_reviews.author: mreast

customer_reviews.title: New scent is TERRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe Dreft changed the scent into something so perfume-y and fragrant! It's absolutely AWFUL. Just why?! I will not be buying anymore.

customer_reviews.title: Smells amazing. Should consider packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Love the smell so much. Great laundry soap. Did arrive leaking though. The laundry soap is two bottles inside of a box. Then that box is inside of an amazon box when it arrives. The bottles have nothing keeping them from leaking if the top isn’t fully secured. I didn’t loose much but it did leak somewhat. Made the box smell amazing though lol and the first box prevented the leak from reaching the main amazon box which kept my other items clean of the soap.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I thought these were larger jugs than they are, ...

customer_reviews.author: Anthroariel

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but works.

I admit I was skeptical initially and figured a regular detergent with an extra rinse cycle would work just as well, but at 10 months regular Tide gave her a rash from the bib and the food stains were largely still there. I figure the extra expense is worth it.
